url.description: Url to another reviewpad.yml configuration file

action.description: Action to run. This action needs to be an aladino built-in function.

label.description: A label is used to sort and describe pull requests.

description.description: A short description of the label. Must be 100 characters or fewer.

color.description: The hexadecimal color code for the label, without the leading #.

rule.description: A rule specifies a filter over a pull request.

name.description: Name of the rule. Used to identify the rule.

description.description: The description can be used to provide more details about the rule.

kind.description: The kind of a rule. The kind is related to different properties of pull requests that will be used in the evaluation of the 'spec' field.

spec.description: The spec is a boolean expression in a domain specific language called Aladino (Portuguese translation of Aladdin).

if.description: Defines a set of rules. It can also specify a set o extra actions to run when the rules are true.

rule.description: Rule to be meet. This rule must the defined in 'rules', otherwise an error will be triggered.

extra-actions.description: List of all extra action to be run then the defined rules are meet. This extra action run after the action defined in the workflow.

workflow.description: A workflow specifies a set of rules that need to be meet in order to run a defined set of actions.

description.description: The description can be used to provide more details about the workflow.

if.description: In the if field, we can specify references to multiple rules. For each rule, we can also specify a list of extra actions that will be executed if this rule is activated by the pull request.

then.description: The set of actions to be executed when all rules are true.

groupBasic.description: A group specifies a set of users in the repository where the workflow runs.

name.description: Name of the group. Used to identify the group.

description.description: The description can be used to provide more details about the group.

spec.description: The spec is an expression in a domain specific language called Aladino that is evaluated to an array of users.

groupWithType.description: A group specifies a set of users in the repository where the workflow runs.

name.description: Name of the group. Used to identify the group.

description.description: The description can be used to provide more details about the group.

type.description: The type of a group. Represents the type function to the applied to the group.

param.description: Param describes the parameter name to be used on the 'spec' expression.

where.description: The where is an expression in a domain specific language called Aladino that is evaluated to an array of users.

api-version.description: The version of revy to be used. You can set the value to 'reviewpad.com/v1alpha'.

mode.description: The mode in which reviewpad will run. 'verbose' to add a comment on the pull request with the triggered workflows. 'silent' to run without any comment. By default the mode is 'silent'

edition.description: The edition in which reviewpad will run. 'team' to benefit from the open source built-ins. 'professional' to benefit from all the built-ins available in the documentation. By default the mode is 'team'

imports.description: List of all imports to be loaded. This is used in order to allow to split configuration files and use them across different projects.

labels.description: List labels to be used. Labels that do not exist in the project will be created using the provided color and description

rules.description: List of all rules that will be used in the workflows. All rules defined here should be used, otherwise an error will be triggered.

workflows.description: List of all workflows. A workflow is tested against the selected rules and if all rules evaluate to true, then all defined actions run.

groups.description: List of all groups. A group corresponds to a set of users in the repo where the pull request occurs.
